description:
When trying to upload a bundle with :

euca-upload-bundle -b mybucket -m /tmp/kernel.manifest.xml

I am getting this error :

<class 'gflags.DuplicateFlagError'>: The flag 'flat_network_bridge' is defined twice. First from nova.flags, Second from nova.flags

full stacktrack  here :

http://c0403512.cdn.cloudfiles.rackspacecloud.com/a.html

Chmouel.
title: uploading bundle failure

comments.content:
When trying to upload a bundle with :

euca-upload-bundle -b mybucket -m /tmp/kernel.manifest.xml

I am getting this error :

<class 'gflags.DuplicateFlagError'>: The flag 'flat_network_bridge' is defined twice. First from nova.flags, Second from nova.flags

full stacktrack  here :

http://c0403512.cdn.cloudfiles.rackspacecloud.com/a.html

Chmouel.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~chmouel

comments.content:
It's easy to avoid the duplication :

http://paste.openstack.org/show/32/

not sure if tracking those multiple re-import is worthwhile aside of being a optimisation bonus.

I shall now learn how to use launchpad and try to figure out how to propose a branch merge....
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~chmouel

comments.content: Ok this is weird one I have reinstalled the full packages from the ppa and I don't seem to have this problem anymore....
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~chmouel
